articles.description: Sudden change of boarding stations in Lucknow forces them to scamper from one bus station to another in search of transportation
articles.content:
Migrant workers returning from Delhi and other cities of Uttar Pradesh continued to arrive in Lucknow on Sunday but for many their journey home was not without much struggle, confusion and stress due to change in boarding stations.

articles.title: Coronavirus | 28 meat, fish outlets in Salem sealed for violation of social distancing norms
articles.description: Corporation officials conduct surprise checks at shops within its limits
articles.content:
Salem Corporation officials on Sunday sealed 28 meat and fish outlets here for not following personal distancing among consumers.
Being Sunday, more people ventured out despite lockdown here to purchase meat and other non-vegetarian items.

articles.title: Coronavirus | Superintendent of Police distributes safety gadgets, groceries to families of personnel
articles.description: According to the police, for the 21-day lockdown, about 750 police personnel have been deployed in a shift and nearly 20 checkposts have been put up in the district borders.
articles.content:
Superintendent of Police for Salem S. Deepa Ganiger on Sunday distributed groceries and safety equipment to police personnel and their families here.

articles.content:

articles.title: Coronavirus lockdown | Supreme Court hearings on scope of religious freedom lie in limbo
articles.description: Due to COVID-19, only extremely urgent cases are being heard by judges via videoconferencing
articles.content:
The hearings before a nine-judge Supreme Court Bench on the ambit and scope of religious freedom practised by multiple faiths across the country lie in limbo due to the COVID-19 scare.

articles.description: The seven migrant labourers would climb down the trees thrice daily to have meals, and for answering natures call
articles.content:

The families and villagers of seven migrant labourers returning home to Balarampur village in West Bengals Purulia district told them just that, literally.
